page.title: 11TOURISM
page.content: Although the area is quite remote, a large number of tourists visit the area in the summer. This often leads to congestion on the narrow valley road especially at Hartside Farm which marks the end of the council road. Here all visitors must leave their cars (and even buses) in a tiny car-park. There are four things which bring tourists to the area. (a)the hills ,which are used by many folk for walking and even skiing. (b)Linhope hamlet in its beautiful setting. (c)Linhope Spout-located just out of the area. (d)Brough-law ,with its Ancient British Campsite. No jobs have arisen out of tourism in this area. There is no charge for any site in this area.
